intro: Lepidium jarmolenkoi, commonly known as the Armenian cress, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes, and it produces small, rounded seed pods. Lepidium jarmolenkoi is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
